text: Sattagydia (Old Persian: 𐎰𐎫𐎦𐎢𐏁 Thataguš, country of the "hundred cows") was one of the easternmost places of the Achaemenid EmpireHerodotus III 91, III 94 along with Gandārae, Dadicae and Aparytae. It was located east of the Sulaiman Mountains up to the Indus River in the basin around Bannu in modern day's southern Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Pakistan. == References == Category:Achaemenid satrapies
title: Sattagydia
